question: Will Keita Nakajima win the 2025 DP World India Championship?
description:
This market will resolve according to the player who wins the 2025 DP World India Championship, an official DP World Tour event scheduled to take place at the Delhi Golf Club, New Delhi, India, from October 16–19, 2025.

If a listed player withdraws, is disqualified, or otherwise becomes ineligible to win under the official tournament rules, that player’s market will resolve to “No.”

In the event of a tie, this market will resolve according to the official winner as determined by DP World Tour tournament rules (e.g., playoff results).

If no winner is officially announced by December 31, 2025, this market will resolve to “Other.”

The primary resolution sources will be the official results published by the DP World Tour on europeantour.com, and confirmation through PGA TOUR results or other credible media reporting may also be used.

question: Bitcoin Up or Down - October 17, 8PM ET
description:
This market will resolve to "Up" if the close price is greater than or equal to the open price for the BTC/USDT 1 hour candle that begins on the time and date specified in the title. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "Down".

The resolution source for this market is information from Binance, specifically the BTC/USDT pair (https://www.binance.com/en/trade/BTC_USDT). The close « C » and open « O » displayed at the top of the graph for the relevant "1H" candle will be used once the data for that candle is finalized.

Please note that this market is about the price according to Binance BTC/USDT, not according to other sources or spot markets.

question: Spread: Pistons (-6.5)
description:
In the upcoming NBA game, scheduled for October 16 at 7:00 PM ET:

This market will resolve to "Pistons" if the Pistons win the game by 7 or more points.

Otherwise, this market will resolve to "Wizards". If the game ends in a tie, this market will resolve to "Wizards".

If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed. If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.

question: Apple (AAPL) Up or Down on October 16?
description:
This market will resolve to "Up" if the official NASDAQ closing price for Apple (AAPL) on Thursday, October 16, 2025 is higher than the official NASDAQ closing price for AAPL on the most recent prior trading day.

This market will resolve to "Down" if the official NASDAQ closing price for Apple (AAPL) on Thursday, October 16, 2025 is lower than the official NASDAQ closing price for AAPL on the most recent prior trading day.

E.g., ordinarily, a market on Monday would refer to the previous Friday for its most recent closing price, unless that Friday were a market holiday, in which case it would refer to Thursday, or the next most recent trading day.

If the two specified closing prices are exactly equal, this market will resolve 50-50. Note that all figures will be rounded to the nearest cent using standard rounding.

If AAPL does not trade at all during the regular session, the market will resolve 50-50.

If either of the relevant days are shortened (for example, due to a market holiday schedule), the official closing price published by NASDAQ for that shortened session will still be used for resolution.

If either of the relevant days have no official closing price (for example, due to a trading halt into the market close, system issue, delisting, or other disruption), the market will use the last valid on-exchange trade price of the regular session as the effective closing price.

The resolution source for this market is NASDAQ, specifically the exchange-certified Close values published at https://www.nasdaq.com/market-activity/quotes/historical.

If the two specified closing prices are exactly equal, this market will resolve 50-50. Note that all figures will be rounded to the nearest cent using standard rounding.

If DJI does not trade at all during the regular session, the market will resolve 50-50.

If either of the relevant days are shortened (for example, due to a market holiday schedule), the official closing price published by Dow Jones Industrial Average for that shortened session will still be used for resolution.

If either of the relevant days have no official closing price (for example, due to a trading halt into the market close, system issue, delisting, or other disruption), the market will use the last valid on-exchange trade price of the regular session as the effective closing price.

The resolution source for this market is the Wall Street Journal, specifically the Close values published by the WSJ under "Historical Prices".

question: XRP Up or Down - October 18, 12AM ET
description:
This market will resolve to "Up" if the close price is greater than or equal to the open price for the XRP/USDT 1 hour candle that begins on the time and date specified in the title. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "Down".

The resolution source for this market is information from Binance, specifically the XRP/USDT pair (https://www.binance.com/en/trade/XRP_USDT). The close « C » and open « O » displayed at the top of the graph for the relevant "1H" candle will be used once the data for that candle is finalized.

Please note that this market is about the price according to Binance XRP/USDT, not according to other sources or spot markets.

question: Blue Jays vs. Mariners
description:
In the upcoming MLB game, scheduled for October 17 at 6:08PM ET:
If the Toronto Blue Jays win, the market will resolve to “Blue Jays”.
If the Seattle Mariners win, the market will resolve to “Mariners”.
If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed.
If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.
To know when a postponed game will be played, please check the home team's schedule on MLB.com for the listed team and look for the game described as a makeup game.

question: Counter-Strike: FUT Esports vs FaZe (BO3)
description:
This market will resolve to "FUT Esports" if FUT Esports win against FaZe in the named Counter-Strike match.

This market will resolve to "FaZe" if FaZe win against FUT Esports in the Counter-Strike match.

question: Bitcoin Up or Down - October 18, 8AM ET
description:
This market will resolve to "Up" if the close price is greater than or equal to the open price for the BTC/USDT 1 hour candle that begins on the time and date specified in the title. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "Down".

The resolution source for this market is information from Binance, specifically the BTC/USDT pair (https://www.binance.com/en/trade/BTC_USDT). The close « C » and open « O » displayed at the top of the graph for the relevant "1H" candle will be used once the data for that candle is finalized.

Please note that this market is about the price according to Binance BTC/USDT, not according to other sources or spot markets.

question: Counter-Strike: Keyd vs FOLHA AMARELA (BO3)
description:
This market will resolve to "Keyd" if Keyd win against FOLHA AMARELA in the named Counter-Strike match.

This market will resolve to "FOLHA AMARELA" if FOLHA AMARELA win against Keyd in the Counter-Strike match.

If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed.

If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source for this market will be official information from liquipedia: https://liquipedia.net/counterstrike/Main_Page

question: Spread: Pistons (-7.5)
description:
In the upcoming NBA game, scheduled for October 16 at 7:00 PM ET:

This market will resolve to "Pistons" if the Pistons win the game by 8 or more points.

Otherwise, this market will resolve to "Wizards". If the game ends in a tie, this market will resolve to "Wizards".

If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed. If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.

events.title: Wizards vs. Pistons
events.description:
In the upcoming NBA game, scheduled for October 16 at 7:00PM ET:
If the Wizards win, the market will resolve to "Wizards".
If the Pistons win, the market will resolve to "Pistons".

If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.
The result will be determined based on the final score including any overtime periods.

question: Apple (AAPL) Up or Down on October 17?
description:
This market will resolve to "Up" if the official NASDAQ closing price for Apple (AAPL) on Friday, October 17, 2025 is higher than the official NASDAQ closing price for AAPL on the most recent prior trading day.

This market will resolve to "Down" if the official NASDAQ closing price for Apple (AAPL) on Friday, October 17, 2025 is lower than the official NASDAQ closing price for AAPL on the most recent prior trading day.

E.g., ordinarily, a market on Monday would refer to the previous Friday for its most recent closing price, unless that Friday were a market holiday, in which case it would refer to Thursday, or the next most recent trading day.

If the two specified closing prices are exactly equal, this market will resolve 50-50. Note that all figures will be rounded to the nearest cent using standard rounding.

If AAPL does not trade at all during the regular session, the market will resolve 50-50.

If either of the relevant days are shortened (for example, due to a market holiday schedule), the official closing price published by NASDAQ for that shortened session will still be used for resolution.

If either of the relevant days have no official closing price (for example, due to a trading halt into the market close, system issue, delisting, or other disruption), the market will use the last valid on-exchange trade price of the regular session as the effective closing price.

The resolution source for this market is NASDAQ, specifically the exchange-certified Close values published at https://www.nasdaq.com/market-activity/quotes/historical.

question: Will Stokes Twins' next video get less than 2 million views on day 1?
description:
This market will resolve to according to the number of views the next YouTube video posted by Stokes Twins gets in the first 24hrs after being posted.

If Stokes Twins does not post a YouTube video by December 31, 2025, 11:59 PM ET this market will resolve to the lowest listed bracket.

If the reported value falls exactly between two brackets, then this market will resolve to the higher range bracket.

The resolution source for this is Stokes Twins' YouTube channel (https://www.youtube.com/@StokesTwins), specifically the 'views' counter for the described video.

Note: This market refers to Stokes Twins' next video posted. Shorts, previews, or other videos released other than the referenced video will not be considered.

question: Will the highest temperature in London be 53°F or below on October 18?
description:

question: Bitcoin Up or Down - October 16, 2:30PM-2:45PM ET
description:
This market will resolve to "Up" if the Bitcoin price at the end of the time range specified in the title is greater than or equal to the price at the beginning of that range. Otherwise, it will resolve to "Down".
The resolution source for this market is information from Chainlink, specifically the BTC/USD data stream available at https://data.chain.link/streams/btc-usd.
Please note that this market is about the price according to Chainlink data stream BTC/USD, not according to other sources or spot markets.

question: Will Stokes Twins' next video get less than 10 million views on week 1?
description:
This market will resolve according to the number of views the next YouTube video posted by Stokes Twins gets in the first 7 days after being posted.

If Stokes Twins does not post a YouTube video by December 31, 2025, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to the lowest range bracket.

If the reported value falls exactly between two brackets, this market will resolve to the higher range bracket.

The resolution source for this is Stokes Twins' YouTube channel (https://www.youtube.com/@StokesTwins), specifically the 'views' counter for the described video.

Note: This market refers to Stokes Twins' next video posted. Shorts, previews, or other videos released other than the referenced video will not be considered.

question: Ningbo Open: Ekaterina Alexandrova vs McCartney Kessler
description:
This is a polymarket on the tennis match between Ekaterina Alexandrova and McCartney Kessler in the Ningbo Open, scheduled for October 17 at 2:30AM ET.

This market will resolve to 'Alexandrova' if Ekaterina Alexandrova advances against McCartney Kessler.

This market will resolve to 'Kessler' if McCartney Kessler advances against Ekaterina Alexandrova.

If the match is canceled (not played at all), ends in a tie, or is delayed beyond 7 days from the scheduled date without a winner determined, this market will resolve to 50-50.

If the match ends in a walkover (player withdraws before the start and the other advances automatically), this market will resolve in favor of the player(s) who officially advances to the next round.

The primary resolution source will be official information from the WTA Tour. A consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question: Ningbo Open: Ajla Tomljanovic vs Elena Rybakina
description:
This is a polymarket on the tennis match between Ajla Tomljanovic and Elena Rybakina in the Ningbo Open, scheduled for October 17 at 4:00AM ET.

This market will resolve to 'Tomljanovic' if Ajla Tomljanovic advances against Elena Rybakina.

This market will resolve to 'Rybakina' if Elena Rybakina advances against Ajla Tomljanovic.

If the match is canceled (not played at all), ends in a tie, or is delayed beyond 7 days from the scheduled date without a winner determined, this market will resolve to 50-50.

If the match ends in a walkover (player withdraws before the start and the other advances automatically), this market will resolve in favor of the player(s) who officially advances to the next round.

The primary resolution source will be official information from the WTA Tour. A consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question: LoL: Movistar KOI vs Fnatic (BO3)
description:
This market will resolve to "Movistar KOI" if Movistar KOI win against Fnatic in the named LoL match.

This market will resolve to "Fnatic" if Fnatic win against Movistar KOI in the LoL match.

If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed.

If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source for this market will be official information from liquipedia: https://liquipedia.net/leagueoflegends/Main_Page

question: Will the price of XRP be above $2.20 on October 23?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if the Binance 1 minute candle for XRP/USDT 12:00 in the ET timezone (noon) on the date specified in the title has a final “Close” price higher than the price specified in the title. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source for this market is Binance, specifically the XRP/USDT "Close" prices currently available at https://www.binance.com/en/trade/XRP_USDT with “1m” and “Candles” selected on the top bar.

Please note that this market is about the price according to Binance XRP/USDT, not according to other sources or spot markets.

Price precision is determined by the number of decimal places in the source.

question: Dolphins vs. Browns: O/U 39.5
description:
In the upcoming NFL game, scheduled for October 19 at 1:00 PM ET:

This market will resolve to "Over" if the Dolphins and Browns combine to score 40 or more points in this game.

If the combined total is less than 40, this market will resolve to "Under".

If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed. If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.

question: Bitcoin Up or Down - October 17, 12:00AM-4:00AM ET

question: Will Trump say "Million" or "Billion" or "Trillion" 10+ times during announcement today?
description:
Donald Trump is scheduled to make an announcement on October 16, 2025, 3:00 PM ET (see https://rollcall.com/factbase/trump/topic/calendar/).

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Donald Trump says the listed term during his appearance at the specified event. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No".

Pluralization/possessive of the listed term will count toward the resolution of this market.

Instances where the term is used in a compound word will count regardless of context (e.g. joyful is not a compound word for "joy," however "killjoy" is a compounding of the words "kill" and "joy").

If this market requires a specified number of mentions of a person’s first or last name, a full-name mention will count as one mention (e.g., if a market is about “Joe / Biden 5+ times,” a mention of “Joe Biden” will count once).

This market is explicitly about the scheduled event featuring Donald Trump titled "The President makes an Announcement" (https://rollcall.com/factbase/trump/topic/calendar/). Speeches, events, or comments that occur outside of the named, scheduled event will not qualify toward this market's resolution. If the events contain a Q&A, it will count toward the resolution of this market.

If this event is definitively cancelled, or otherwise is not aired by October 16, 2025, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source will be video of the events.

question: Bitcoin Up or Down - October 16, 3:15PM-3:30PM ET
description:
This market will resolve to "Up" if the Bitcoin price at the end of the time range specified in the title is greater than or equal to the price at the beginning of that range. Otherwise, it will resolve to "Down".
The resolution source for this market is information from Chainlink, specifically the BTC/USD data stream available at https://data.chain.link/streams/btc-usd.
Please note that this market is about the price according to Chainlink data stream BTC/USD, not according to other sources or spot markets.

question: Will Trump say "Trillion" or "Million" or "Billion" 10+ times during Australia PM events on October 20?
description:
Donald Trump is scheduled to participate in events with the Prime Minister of Australia on October 20, 2025 (see https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/trump-meet-australias-pm-washington-oct-20-white-house-official-says-2025-09-23/).

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Donald Trump says the listed term during his appearance at events featuring the Prime Minister of Australia on October 20, 2025. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No".

Pluralization/possessive of the listed term will count toward the resolution of this market.

Instances where the term is used in a compound word will count regardless of context (e.g. joyful is not a compound word for "joy," however "killjoy" is a compounding of the words "kill" and "joy").

If this market requires a specified number of mentions of a person’s first or last name, a full-name mention will count as one mention (e.g., if a market is about “Joe / Biden 5+ times,” a mention of “Joe Biden” will count once).

This market is explicitly about scheduled events featuring both Donald Trump and the Prime Minister of Australia (https://rollcall.com/factbase/trump/topic/calendar/). All such scheduled events featuring both on this date count. Speeches, events, or comments that occur outside of named, scheduled events, or which feature one named individual but not the other, will not qualify toward this market's resolution. If the events contain a Q&A, it will count toward the resolution of this market.

If this event is definitively cancelled, or otherwise is not aired by October 20, 2025, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source will be video of the events.

question: Ethereum Up or Down - October 16, 3:45PM-4:00PM ET
description:
This market will resolve to "Up" if the Ethereum price at the end of the time range specified in the title is greater than or equal to the price at the beginning of that range. Otherwise, it will resolve to "Down".
The resolution source for this market is information from Chainlink, specifically the ETH/USD data stream available at https://data.chain.link/streams/eth-usd.
Please note that this market is about the price according to Chainlink data stream ETH/USD, not according to other sources or spot markets.

question: Meteora FDV above $750M one day after launch?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if the Fully Diluted Valuation of Meteora's token is greater than the value specified in the title 1 day after launch. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No."

The token must be actively, publicly transferable and tradable to be considered a launch.

"1 day after launch" is defined as 4:00 PM ET on the calendar day following launch. The resolution source for this market is the most liquid price source available. If Meteora doesn't launch a token by December 31, 2025, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "No".

description:

question: Will Trump say "AUKUS" during Australia PM events on October 20?
description:
Donald Trump is scheduled to participate in events with the Prime Minister of Australia on October 20, 2025 (see https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/trump-meet-australias-pm-washington-oct-20-white-house-official-says-2025-09-23/).

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Donald Trump says the listed term during his appearance at events featuring the Prime Minister of Australia on October 20, 2025. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No".

Pluralization/possessive of the listed term will count toward the resolution of this market.

Instances where the term is used in a compound word will count regardless of context (e.g. joyful is not a compound word for "joy," however "killjoy" is a compounding of the words "kill" and "joy").

If this market requires a specified number of mentions of a person’s first or last name, a full-name mention will count as one mention (e.g., if a market is about “Joe / Biden 5+ times,” a mention of “Joe Biden” will count once).

This market is explicitly about scheduled events featuring both Donald Trump and the Prime Minister of Australia (https://rollcall.com/factbase/trump/topic/calendar/). All such scheduled events featuring both on this date count. Speeches, events, or comments that occur outside of named, scheduled events, or which feature one named individual but not the other, will not qualify toward this market's resolution. If the events contain a Q&A, it will count toward the resolution of this market.

If this event is definitively cancelled, or otherwise is not aired by October 20, 2025, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source will be video of the events.

question: Bitcoin ETF Flows on October 17?
description:
This market will resolve to “Positive” if total Bitcoin ETF flows on the date specified in the title are greater than 0, and to “Negative” if they are less than 0.

If flows are exactly 0, the market will resolve to 50-50.

The resolution source is Farside Investors, specifically the ETF Flow tab available at https://farside.co.uk/btc/ in the “Total” column for the date specified in the title.

The total flows will be considered finalized for that day once flows for all ETF providers have been published. If data for any ETF provider remains unpublished by 12 PM ET, 2 days after the date specified in the title, the market will resolve based on all available data published up to that time.

If the resolution source becomes permanently unavailable or fails to publish any data by 12 PM ET, 2 days after the specified date, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: Bitcoin Up or Down - October 18, 4PM ET
description:
This market will resolve to "Up" if the close price is greater than or equal to the open price for the BTC/USDT 1 hour candle that begins on the time and date specified in the title. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "Down".

The resolution source for this market is information from Binance, specifically the BTC/USDT pair (https://www.binance.com/en/trade/BTC_USDT). The close « C » and open « O » displayed at the top of the graph for the relevant "1H" candle will be used once the data for that candle is finalized.

Please note that this market is about the price according to Binance BTC/USDT, not according to other sources or spot markets.

question: Will Northern Trust (NTRS) beat quarterly earnings?
description:
Northern Trust is estimated to release earnings on October 22, 2025. The Street consensus estimate for Northern Trust's GAAP EPS for the relevant quarter is $2.24. This market will resolve to "Yes" if Northern Trust reports GAAP EPS greater than $2.24 for the relevant quarter in its next quarterly earnings release. Otherwise, it will resolve to "No." The resolution source will be the GAAP EPS listed in the company’s official earnings documents. 

If Northern Trust releases earnings without GAAP EPS, then the market will resolve according to the GAAP EPS figure reported by SeekingAlpha. If no such figure is published within 96h of market close (4:00:00pm ET) on the day earnings are announced, the market will resolve to “No”.

If the company does not release earnings within 45 calendar days of the estimated earnings date, this market will resolve to “No.” 

Note: Subsequent restatements, corrections, or revisions made to the initially announced GAAP EPS figure will not qualify for resolution, except in the case of obvious and immediate mistakes (e.g., fat finger errors, as with Lyft's (LYFT) earnings release in February 2024).
Note: The strike prices used in these markets are derived from SeekingAlpha estimates, and reflect the consensus of sell-side analyst estimates for GAAP EPS. 
Note: All figures will be rounded to the nearest cent using standard rounding.
Note: For the purposes of this market, IFRS EPS will be treated as GAAP EPS.
Note: For the purposes of this market, GAAP EPS refers to diluted GAAP EPS, unless this is not published, in which case it refers to basic GAAP EPS.
Note: All figures are expressed in USD, unless otherwise indicated.

question: Will O'Reilly Automotive (ORLY) beat quarterly earnings?
description:
O'Reilly Automotive is estimated to release earnings on October 22, 2025. The Street consensus estimate for O'Reilly Automotive's GAAP EPS for the relevant quarter is $0.83. This market will resolve to "Yes" if O'Reilly Automotive reports GAAP EPS greater than $0.83 for the relevant quarter in its next quarterly earnings release. Otherwise, it will resolve to "No." The resolution source will be the GAAP EPS listed in the company’s official earnings documents. 

If O'Reilly Automotive releases earnings without GAAP EPS, then the market will resolve according to the GAAP EPS figure reported by SeekingAlpha. If no such figure is published within 96h of market close (4:00:00pm ET) on the day earnings are announced, the market will resolve to “No”.

If the company does not release earnings within 45 calendar days of the estimated earnings date, this market will resolve to “No.” 

Note: Subsequent restatements, corrections, or revisions made to the initially announced GAAP EPS figure will not qualify for resolution, except in the case of obvious and immediate mistakes (e.g., fat finger errors, as with Lyft's (LYFT) earnings release in February 2024).
Note: The strike prices used in these markets are derived from SeekingAlpha estimates, and reflect the consensus of sell-side analyst estimates for GAAP EPS. 
Note: All figures will be rounded to the nearest cent using standard rounding.
Note: For the purposes of this market, IFRS EPS will be treated as GAAP EPS.
Note: For the purposes of this market, GAAP EPS refers to diluted GAAP EPS, unless this is not published, in which case it refers to basic GAAP EPS.
Note: All figures are expressed in USD, unless otherwise indicated.

question: Will Otis Worldwide (OTIS) beat quarterly earnings?
description:
Otis Worldwide is estimated to release earnings on October 29, 2025. The Street consensus estimate for Otis Worldwide’s non-GAAP EPS for the relevant quarter is $1.00. This market will resolve to "Yes" if Otis Worldwide reports non-GAAP EPS greater than $1.00 for the relevant quarter in its next quarterly earnings release. Otherwise, it will resolve to "No." The resolution source will be the non-GAAP EPS listed in the company’s official earnings documents. 

If Otis Worldwide releases earnings without non-GAAP EPS, then the market will resolve according to the non-GAAP EPS figure reported by SeekingAlpha. If no such figure is published within 96h of market close (4:00:00pm ET) on the day earnings are announced, the market will resolve according to the GAAP EPS listed in the company’s official earnings documents; or, if not published there, according to the GAAP EPS provided by SeekingAlpha. If no GAAP EPS number is available from either source at that time, the market will resolve to “No.” (For the purposes of this market, GAAP EPS refers to diluted GAAP EPS, unless it is not published, in which case it refers to basic GAAP EPS.)

If the company does not release earnings within 45 calendar days of the estimated earnings date, this market will resolve to “No.” 

Note: Subsequent restatements, corrections, or revisions made to the initially announced non-GAAP EPS figure will not qualify for resolution, except in the case of obvious and immediate mistakes (e.g., fat finger errors, as with Lyft's (LYFT) earnings release in February 2024).
Note: The strike prices used in these markets are derived from SeekingAlpha estimates, and reflect the consensus of sell-side analyst estimates for non-GAAP EPS.
Note: All figures will be rounded to the nearest cent using standard rounding.
Note: For the purposes of this market, IFRS EPS will be treated as GAAP EPS.
Note: If multiple versions of non-GAAP EPS are published, the market will resolve according to the primary headline non-GAAP EPS number, which is typically presented on a diluted basis. If diluted is not published, then basic non-GAAP EPS will qualify.
Note: All figures are expressed in USD, unless otherwise indicated.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Raymond James Financial reports non-GAAP EPS greater than $2.83 for the relevant quarter in its next quarterly earnings release. Otherwise, it will resolve to "No." The resolution source will be the non-GAAP EPS listed in the company’s official earnings documents. 

If Raymond James Financial releases earnings without non-GAAP EPS, then the market will resolve according to the non-GAAP EPS figure reported by SeekingAlpha. If no such figure is published within 96h of market close (4:00:00pm ET) on the day earnings are announced, the market will resolve according to the GAAP EPS listed in the company’s official earnings documents; or, if not published there, according to the GAAP EPS provided by SeekingAlpha. If no GAAP EPS number is available from either source at that time, the market will resolve to “No.” (For the purposes of this market, GAAP EPS refers to diluted GAAP EPS, unless it is not published, in which case it refers to basic GAAP EPS.)

If the company does not release earnings within 45 calendar days of the estimated earnings date, this market will resolve to “No.” 

Note: Subsequent restatements, corrections, or revisions made to the initially announced non-GAAP EPS figure will not qualify for resolution, except in the case of obvious and immediate mistakes (e.g., fat finger errors, as with Lyft's (LYFT) earnings release in February 2024).
Note: The strike prices used in these markets are derived from SeekingAlpha estimates, and reflect the consensus of sell-side analyst estimates for non-GAAP EPS.
Note: All figures will be rounded to the nearest cent using standard rounding.
Note: For the purposes of this market, IFRS EPS will be treated as GAAP EPS.
Note: If multiple versions of non-GAAP EPS are published, the market will resolve according to the primary headline non-GAAP EPS number, which is typically presented on a diluted basis. If diluted is not published, then basic non-GAAP EPS will qualify.
Note: All figures are expressed in USD, unless otherwise indicated.

question: Bitcoin Up or Down - October 18, 6PM ET
description:
This market will resolve to "Up" if the close price is greater than or equal to the open price for the BTC/USDT 1 hour candle that begins on the time and date specified in the title. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "Down".

The resolution source for this market is information from Binance, specifically the BTC/USDT pair (https://www.binance.com/en/trade/BTC_USDT). The close « C » and open « O » displayed at the top of the graph for the relevant "1H" candle will be used once the data for that candle is finalized.

Please note that this market is about the price according to Binance BTC/USDT, not according to other sources or spot markets.

question: Almaty Open: Jan-Lennard Struff vs Corentin Moutet
description:
This is a polymarket on the tennis match between Jan-Lennard Struff and Corentin Moutet in the Almaty Open, scheduled for October 17 at 10:00AM ET.

This market will resolve to 'Struff' if Jan-Lennard Struff advances against Corentin Moutet.

This market will resolve to 'Moutet' if Corentin Moutet advances against Jan-Lennard Struff.

If the match is canceled (not played at all), ends in a tie, or is delayed beyond 7 days from the scheduled date without a winner determined, this market will resolve to 50-50.

If the match ends in a walkover (player withdraws before the start and the other advances automatically), this market will resolve in favor of the player(s) who officially advances to the next round.

The primary resolution source will be official information from the ATP Tour. A consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question: Panthers vs. Jets: O/U 41.5
description:
In the upcoming NFL game, scheduled for October 19 at 1:00 PM ET:

This market will resolve to "Over" if the Panthers and Jets combine to score 42 or more points in this game.

If the combined total is less than 42, this market will resolve to "Under".

If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed. If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.

question: Bitcoin Up or Down - October 16, 9:45PM-10:00PM ET
description:
This market will resolve to "Up" if the Bitcoin price at the end of the time range specified in the title is greater than or equal to the price at the beginning of that range. Otherwise, it will resolve to "Down".
The resolution source for this market is information from Chainlink, specifically the BTC/USD data stream available at https://data.chain.link/streams/btc-usd.
Please note that this market is about the price according to Chainlink data stream BTC/USD, not according to other sources or spot markets.

Note: If multiple versions of non-GAAP EPS are published, the market will resolve according to the primary headline non-GAAP EPS number, which is typically presented on a diluted basis. If diluted is not published, then basic non-GAAP EPS will qualify.
Note: All figures are expressed in USD, unless otherwise indicated.

question: Will T-Mobile US (TMUS) beat quarterly earnings?
description:
T-Mobile US is estimated to release earnings on October 23, 2025. The Street consensus estimate for T-Mobile US's GAAP EPS for the relevant quarter is $2.40. This market will resolve to "Yes" if T-Mobile US reports GAAP EPS greater than $2.40 for the relevant quarter in its next quarterly earnings release. Otherwise, it will resolve to "No." The resolution source will be the GAAP EPS listed in the company’s official earnings documents. 

If T-Mobile US releases earnings without GAAP EPS, then the market will resolve according to the GAAP EPS figure reported by SeekingAlpha. If no such figure is published within 96h of market close (4:00:00pm ET) on the day earnings are announced, the market will resolve to “No”.

If the company does not release earnings within 45 calendar days of the estimated earnings date, this market will resolve to “No.” 

Note: Subsequent restatements, corrections, or revisions made to the initially announced GAAP EPS figure will not qualify for resolution, except in the case of obvious and immediate mistakes (e.g., fat finger errors, as with Lyft's (LYFT) earnings release in February 2024).
Note: The strike prices used in these markets are derived from SeekingAlpha estimates, and reflect the consensus of sell-side analyst estimates for GAAP EPS. 
Note: All figures will be rounded to the nearest cent using standard rounding.
Note: For the purposes of this market, IFRS EPS will be treated as GAAP EPS.
Note: For the purposes of this market, GAAP EPS refers to diluted GAAP EPS, unless this is not published, in which case it refers to basic GAAP EPS.
Note: All figures are expressed in USD, unless otherwise indicated.

question: Bitcoin Up or Down - October 18, 7PM ET
description:
This market will resolve to "Up" if the close price is greater than or equal to the open price for the BTC/USDT 1 hour candle that begins on the time and date specified in the title. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "Down".

The resolution source for this market is information from Binance, specifically the BTC/USDT pair (https://www.binance.com/en/trade/BTC_USDT). The close « C » and open « O » displayed at the top of the graph for the relevant "1H" candle will be used once the data for that candle is finalized.

Please note that this market is about the price according to Binance BTC/USDT, not according to other sources or spot markets.

question: UTSA Roadrunners vs. North Texas: O/U 65.5
description:
In the upcoming college football game, scheduled for October 18 at 3:30 PM ET:

This market will resolve to "Over" if UTSA Roadrunners and North Texas combine to score 66 or more points in this game.

If the combined total is less than 66, this market will resolve to "Under".

If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed. If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.
